thread.title: No life on MARS — the ship that can sail itself
thread.title_full: No life on MARS — the ship that can sail itself

title: No life on MARS — the ship that can sail itself
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now No life on MARS — the ship that can sail itself The revolutionary vessel will be unmanned and powered by renewable energy Caters News Agency The revolutionary vessel will be unmanned and powered by renewable energy Caters News Agency Published 1 minute ago 
A “robot” ship able to sail itself and resist pirate attacks could transform the shipping industry, its designers claim (Simon de Bruxelles writes). 
The Mayflower Autonomous Research Ship — MARS — will be powered by wind, solar and wave energy and will be able to make its own decisions about the best course to take, depending on conditions. 
The scientists behind the project hope that it will be the first of a fleet of remote-contolled ships that could one day replace manned vessels. 
Kevin Jones, executive dean of Plymouth University’s faculty of science and engineering, said: “If we can put a rover Subscribe now
